meanings.definition: A list of items, such as books or goods, with details or prices.
meanings.sent1: I found the catalos of books at the library.
meanings.sent2: She checked the catalos to see if the book was available.
meanings.sent3: The catalos was so long, it felt like a never-ending scroll.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a catalos of memories, neatly organized and easily accessible.
meanings.sent5: The catalos was like a treasure map, guiding her to the desired book.

meanings.definition: To make a list of items, such as books or goods, with details or prices.
meanings.sent1: He catalos the inventory every month to keep track of items.
meanings.sent2: They will catalos the products before putting them on sale.
meanings.sent3: She decided to catalos her shoe collection for fun.
meanings.sent4: The detective catalos the clues to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent5: In order to organize the garage, they need to catalos all the tools.

meanings.definition: A publication containing such a list.
meanings.sent1: The catalos arrived in the mail, showcasing the latest products.
meanings.sent2: He picked up the catalos from the store to browse through the offers.
meanings.sent3: The catalos became his favorite bedtime reading material.
meanings.sent4: She used the catalos to plan her shopping trip efficiently.
meanings.sent5: The catalos was like a mini encyclopedia of available items.
